alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 3:53AM EST until January 17 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Precipitation will continue to back in from the Gulf of Maine through this evening as an area of low pressure tracks towards Nova Scotia. Temperatures will generally remain at or below freezing, resulting in mixed wintry precipitation including snow, sleet, and freezing rain. While no single precipitation type is forecast to accumulate to significant levels, the combination of precipitation types will likely result in hazardous travel conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow and sleet accumulations up to two inches for a storm total of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations up to two tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Central Somerset, Northern Franklin, and Southern Franklin Counties. * WHEN...Until Midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...A period of mixed precipitation is expected with air temperatures remaining below freezing. Expect slippery road conditions and avoid travel if possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin
